revised_title: Stage-Dependent Restoration of Sensory Dorsal Columns Following Spinal Cord Transection in Anuran Tadpoles
tldr: The study examines the potential of axons within the ascending dorsal column projection of lumbar dorsal root ganglion cells to grow through the thoracic spinal cord that has been cut at various stages of development in anuran tadpoles. The results show that cord transection is followed by restoration of the ascending dorsal column in a stage-dependent manner. This research provides insights into the restoration of axon pathways in the central nervous system of amphibians and other vertebrates.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
